title: Gianluigi Buffon 'could continue playing until he's 43' at Juventus
text:
Gianluigi Buffon has no interest in retiring from football any time soon and could play until the age of 43 amid reports Juventus are going to offer him a new contract.

The veteran goalkeeper, 41, is back at the Italian giants after a short spell at Paris Saint-Germain but finds himself playing second fiddle to Wojciech Szczesny.

However, according to Italian outlet Tuttosport, Juve are considering offering Buffon a new contract and he is seriously considering accepting it to prolong one of football's greatest careers.

Gianluigi Buffon may play until he turns 43 amid reports Juventus want to offer him a new deal

Buffon re-signed with Juve this summer on a one-year deal but it is thought the club are preparing to offer terms on a contract for another 12 months.

That would take him beyond his 43rd birthday and once again extend the career of one of the game's greatest goalkeepers.

Buffon left Turin in 2018 because he was no longer guaranteed regular playing time and spent one season in the French capital before returning to Italy.

He has played three times in Serie A this season but has mostly been consigned to the bench due to the impressive performances of former Arsenal stopper Szczesny.
description: Juventus are considering offering veteran goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon a new one-year deal and he is seriously considering accepting it to prolong one of football's greatest careers.
